title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 3665/89 of 6 December 1989 concerning the stopping of fishing for mackerel by vessels flying the flag of the Netherlands
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 3665/89
of 6 December 1989
concerning the stopping of fishing for mackerel by vessels flying the flag of the Netherlands
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Catches of mackerel in the waters of ICES divisions II a (EC zone), III a, III b, c, d (EC zone) and IV by vessels flying the flag of the Netherlands or registered in the Netherlands are deemed to have exhausted the quota allocated to the Netherlands for 1989.
Fishing for mackerel in the waters of ICES divisions II a (EC zone), III a, III b, c, d (EC zone) and IV by vessels flying the flag of the Netherlands or registered in the Netherlands is prohibited, as well as the retention on board, the transhipment and the landing of such stock captured by the abovementioned vessels after the date of application of this Regulation.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
It shall apply with effect from 23 November 1989.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 6 December 1989.
For the Commission
Manuel MARĂN
Vice-President
